annotation.spannedText: it is especially important that you advise parents of infants and all people who live with the infant or who provide care to him or her be protected against pertussis

classMention.mentionClass: it is especially important that you advise parents of infants and all people who live with the infant or who provide care to him or her be protected against pertussis

annotation.spannedText: It is recommended that the infant's family members and potential visitors receive a one-time dose of adolescent/adult tetanus-diphtheria-acellular (Tdap) vaccine if they have not already done so

classMention.mentionClass: It is recommended that the infant's family members and potential visitors receive a one-time dose of adolescent/adult tetanus-diphtheria-acellular (Tdap) vaccine if they have not already done so

annotation.spannedText: Persons with a history of pertussis should continue to receive pertussis-containing vaccines according to the recommended schedule

classMention.mentionClass: Persons with a history of pertussis should continue to receive pertussis-containing vaccines according to the recommended schedule

annotation.spannedText: Adolescents or adults who have a history of pertussis disease generally should receive Tdap according to the routine recommendation

classMention.mentionClass: Adolescents or adults who have a history of pertussis disease generally should receive Tdap according to the routine recommendation

annotation.spannedText: You should follow the post-exposure prophylaxis protocol for pertussis exposure recommended by CDC

classMention.mentionClass: You should follow the post-exposure prophylaxis protocol for pertussis exposure recommended by CDC

annotation.spannedText: Until studies define the optimal management of exposed vaccinated healthcare personnel, or experts arrive at consensus, healthcare facilities should continue to follow the post-exposure prophylaxis protocol for vaccinated HCWs who are exposed to pertussis

classMention.mentionClass: Until studies define the optimal management of exposed vaccinated healthcare personnel, or experts arrive at consensus, healthcare facilities should continue to follow the post-exposure prophylaxis protocol for vaccinated HCWs who are exposed to pertussis

annotation.spannedText: All children should receive a series of DTaP at ages 2, 4, and 6 months, with boosters at ages 15-18 months and at 4-6 years

classMention.mentionClass: All children should receive a series of DTaP at ages 2, 4, and 6 months, with boosters at ages 15-18 months and at 4-6 years

annotation.spannedText: Adolescents and adults who have not received a dose of Tdap, or for whom vaccine status is unknown, should receive a single dose of Tdap as soon as feasible. As stated above, Tdap can be administered regardless of interval since the previous Td dose

classMention.mentionClass: Adolescents and adults who have not received a dose of Tdap, or for whom vaccine status is unknown, should receive a single dose of Tdap as soon as feasible. As stated above, Tdap can be administered regardless of interval since the previous Td dose

annotation.spannedText: If needed, they should complete their series with Td

classMention.mentionClass: If needed, they should complete their series with Td

annotation.spannedText: ages 7 through 10 years who are not fully immunized against pertussis (i.e., did not complete a series of pertussis-containing vaccine before their seventh birthday) should receive a single dose of Tdap

classMention.mentionClass: ages 7 through 10 years who are not fully immunized against pertussis (i.e., did not complete a series of pertussis-containing vaccine before their seventh birthday) should receive a single dose of Tdap

annotation.spannedText: All healthcare workers, regardless of age, should receive a single dose of Tdap as soon as feasible if they have not previously received Tdap and regardless of the time since the last dose of Td

classMention.mentionClass: All healthcare workers, regardless of age, should receive a single dose of Tdap as soon as feasible if they have not previously received Tdap and regardless of the time since the last dose of Td

annotation.spannedText: Someone who received a dose of Tdap at age 11 or 12 should receive a booster dose of Td vaccine ten years later, unless tetanus prophylaxis is required sooner due to an injury

classMention.mentionClass: Someone who received a dose of Tdap at age 11 or 12 should receive a booster dose of Td vaccine ten years later, unless tetanus prophylaxis is required sooner due to an injury

annotation.spannedText: As long as your patient has no other contraindications she should receive Tdap now

classMention.mentionClass: As long as your patient has no other contraindications she should receive Tdap now

annotation.spannedText: If she has no documentation of prior tetanus vaccination, she should receive a complete 3-dose primary series (dose #1 of Tdap, followed by dose #2 of Td 4 to 8 weeks later, and dose #3 of Td 6Â–12 months after dose #2)

classMention.mentionClass: If she has no documentation of prior tetanus vaccination, she should receive a complete 3-dose primary series (dose #1 of Tdap, followed by dose #2 of Td 4 to 8 weeks later, and dose #3 of Td 6Â–12 months after dose #2)

annotation.spannedText: vaccination should not be deferred

classMention.mentionClass: vaccination should not be deferred

annotation.spannedText: The dose should be repeated with DTaP

classMention.mentionClass: The dose should be repeated with DTaP

annotation.spannedText: If Tdap was inadvertently administered to a child under age 7 years, it should not be counted as either the first, second, or third dose of DTaP

classMention.mentionClass: If Tdap was inadvertently administered to a child under age 7 years, it should not be counted as either the first, second, or third dose of DTaP

annotation.spannedText: Continue vaccinating on schedule

classMention.mentionClass: Continue vaccinating on schedule

annotation.spannedText: If it's already been given and the person had not yet received Tdap as an adolescent or adult, you should make certain that he gets Tdap as soon as feasible

classMention.mentionClass: If it's already been given and the person had not yet received Tdap as an adolescent or adult, you should make certain that he gets Tdap as soon as feasible

annotation.spannedText: Single antigen tetanus toxoid should only be used in rare instances, for example when a person has had a documented severe allergic response to diphtheria toxoid

classMention.mentionClass: Single antigen tetanus toxoid should only be used in rare instances, for example when a person has had a documented severe allergic response to diphtheria toxoid

annotation.spannedText: You should not assume the tetanus vaccination status for any person based on their age alone

classMention.mentionClass: You should not assume the tetanus vaccination status for any person based on their age alone

annotation.spannedText: Only a written record is acceptable proof of immunization

classMention.mentionClass: Only a written record is acceptable proof of immunization

annotation.spannedText: People without documentation should be assumed to be unimmunized

classMention.mentionClass: People without documentation should be assumed to be unimmunized

annotation.spannedText: Tdap given to a child younger than age 7 years as either dose 1, 2, or 3, is NOT valid

classMention.mentionClass: Tdap given to a child younger than age 7 years as either dose 1, 2, or 3, is NOT valid

annotation.spannedText: Repeat with DTaP as soon as feasible

classMention.mentionClass: Repeat with DTaP as soon as feasible

annotation.spannedText: After receiving Tdap, people should receive Td every 10 years for routine booster immunization against tetanus and diphtheria, according to previously published guidelines

classMention.mentionClass: After receiving Tdap, people should receive Td every 10 years for routine booster immunization against tetanus and diphtheria, according to previously published guidelines

annotation.spannedText: Pregnant women should receive Tdap during each pregnancy

classMention.mentionClass: Pregnant women should receive Tdap during each pregnancy

annotation.spannedText: Providers should not miss an opportunity to vaccinate adults age 65 and older with Tdap

classMention.mentionClass: Providers should not miss an opportunity to vaccinate adults age 65 and older with Tdap

annotation.spannedText: When feasible, providers should administer Boostrix (GSK) to adults age 65 and older as it is licensed for this age group

classMention.mentionClass: When feasible, providers should administer Boostrix (GSK) to adults age 65 and older as it is licensed for this age group

annotation.spannedText: All adolescents should receive one dose of Tdap vaccine to protect them from pertussis, even if they have already received Td

classMention.mentionClass: All adolescents should receive one dose of Tdap vaccine to protect them from pertussis, even if they have already received Td

annotation.spannedText: You should use DTaP in children younger than age 7 years

classMention.mentionClass: You should use DTaP in children younger than age 7 years

annotation.spannedText: All healthcare personnel (HCP), regardless of age, should receive a single dose of Tdap as soon as feasible if they have not previously received Tdap and regardless of the time since last Td dose

classMention.mentionClass: All healthcare personnel (HCP), regardless of age, should receive a single dose of Tdap as soon as feasible if they have not previously received Tdap and regardless of the time since last Td dose

annotation.spannedText: Hospitals and ambulatory-care facilities should provide Tdap for HCP and use approaches that maximize vaccination rates (e.g., education about the benefits of vaccination, convenient access, and the provision of Tdap at no charge)

classMention.mentionClass: Hospitals and ambulatory-care facilities should provide Tdap for HCP and use approaches that maximize vaccination rates (e.g., education about the benefits of vaccination, convenient access, and the provision of Tdap at no charge)

annotation.spannedText: All adults ages 19 years and older who have not yet received a dose of Tdap should receive a single dose

classMention.mentionClass: All adults ages 19 years and older who have not yet received a dose of Tdap should receive a single dose

annotation.spannedText: All pregnant women should receive a dose of Tdap during each pregnancy, preferable between 27 and 36 weeks' gestation

classMention.mentionClass: All pregnant women should receive a dose of Tdap during each pregnancy, preferable between 27 and 36 weeks' gestation

annotation.spannedText: Providers should not miss an opportunity to vaccinate adults ages 65 years and older with Tdap. When feasible, give Boostrix to adults age 65 and older

classMention.mentionClass: Providers should not miss an opportunity to vaccinate adults ages 65 years and older with Tdap. When feasible, give Boostrix to adults age 65 and older

annotation.spannedText: Parents should receive a single dose of Tdap as soon as possible to protect their baby from pertussis

classMention.mentionClass: Parents should receive a single dose of Tdap as soon as possible to protect their baby from pertussis

annotation.spannedText: If a dose of Td was given within the previous 2 years, parents should still be vaccinated with Tdap as soon as possible regardless of the time interval since the last dose of Td

classMention.mentionClass: If a dose of Td was given within the previous 2 years, parents should still be vaccinated with Tdap as soon as possible regardless of the time interval since the last dose of Td

annotation.spannedText: Other household contacts that are not up to date with their pertussis-containing vaccinations should also be appropriately vaccinated

classMention.mentionClass: Other household contacts that are not up to date with their pertussis-containing vaccinations should also be appropriately vaccinated

annotation.spannedText: they should be vaccinated before the infant is born

classMention.mentionClass: they should be vaccinated before the infant is born

annotation.spannedText: If there is no written documentation that she received a dose of Tdap prior to or during pregnancy, a dose of Tdap should be administered to her immediately postpartum

classMention.mentionClass: If there is no written documentation that she received a dose of Tdap prior to or during pregnancy, a dose of Tdap should be administered to her immediately postpartum

annotation.spannedText: it is not recommended to give another dose of Tdap in such cases. Optimal timing for Tdap administration is between 27 and 36 weeks' gestation because of transplacental antibody kinetics

classMention.mentionClass: it is not recommended to give another dose of Tdap in such cases. Optimal timing for Tdap administration is between 27 and 36 weeks' gestation because of transplacental antibody kinetics

annotation.spannedText: To maximize maternal antibody response and passive antibody transfer to the infant, the optimal time to administer Tdap is between 27 and 36 weeks' gestation

classMention.mentionClass: To maximize maternal antibody response and passive antibody transfer to the infant, the optimal time to administer Tdap is between 27 and 36 weeks' gestation

annotation.spannedText: Children, ages 7 years and older, and adults who have never received tetanus-containing vaccines, or whose vaccination history is unknown, should receive the 3-dose series

classMention.mentionClass: Children, ages 7 years and older, and adults who have never received tetanus-containing vaccines, or whose vaccination history is unknown, should receive the 3-dose series

annotation.spannedText: You should try to achieve at least 4 total doses

classMention.mentionClass: You should try to achieve at least 4 total doses

annotation.spannedText: In general, a child should receive no more than four doses of DTaP before 4 years of age (preferably by 2 years of age)

classMention.mentionClass: In general, a child should receive no more than four doses of DTaP before 4 years of age (preferably by 2 years of age)

annotation.spannedText: If the child has not received all of the age-appropriate doses of pertussis-containing vaccine, it would be best to try to administer as many doses of DTaP as possible before the child reaches his 7th birthday in order to confer protection against pertussis. Give additional doses of DTaP with 4 week intervals until you achieve 3 total doses. Then, give additional doses with 6-month intervals, not to exceed 6 total doses of diphtheria- and tetanus-containing vaccine by the child's 7th birthday

classMention.mentionClass: If the child has not received all of the age-appropriate doses of pertussis-containing vaccine, it would be best to try to administer as many doses of DTaP as possible before the child reaches his 7th birthday in order to confer protection against pertussis. Give additional doses of DTaP with 4 week intervals until you achieve 3 total doses. Then, give additional doses with 6-month intervals, not to exceed 6 total doses of diphtheria- and tetanus-containing vaccine by the child's 7th birthday

annotation.spannedText: Women who have never received Tdap and who did not receive it during pregnancy should receive it immediately postpartum or as soon as possible thereafter

classMention.mentionClass: Women who have never received Tdap and who did not receive it during pregnancy should receive it immediately postpartum or as soon as possible thereafter

annotation.spannedText: An infant with a recent seizure or an evolving neurologic condition should not receive further doses of DTaP, or DT until the condition has been evaluated and stabilized. Other indicated vaccines may be administered on schedule

classMention.mentionClass: An infant with a recent seizure or an evolving neurologic condition should not receive further doses of DTaP, or DT until the condition has been evaluated and stabilized. Other indicated vaccines may be administered on schedule

annotation.spannedText: To assure that the child is at least protected against tetanus and diphtheria, the decision to give either DTaP or DT should be made no later than the first birthday

classMention.mentionClass: To assure that the child is at least protected against tetanus and diphtheria, the decision to give either DTaP or DT should be made no later than the first birthday

annotation.spannedText: Children and adults age 10 and older should receive a single dose of Tdap instead of Td, if they have not previously received Tdap

classMention.mentionClass: Children and adults age 10 and older should receive a single dose of Tdap instead of Td, if they have not previously received Tdap

annotation.spannedText: Children who are ages 7 through 9 years and haven't had at least 3 doses of pertussis-containing vaccine prior to their seventh birthday (or are unsure), should be given Tdap If Tdap is not available, or was previously administered, these people should receive Td

classMention.mentionClass: Children who are ages 7 through 9 years and haven't had at least 3 doses of pertussis-containing vaccine prior to their seventh birthday (or are unsure), should be given Tdap If Tdap is not available, or was previously administered, these people should receive Td

annotation.spannedText: The decision to delay a booster dose of tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine following an injury should be based on the nature of the injury and likelihood that the injured person is susceptible to tetanus

classMention.mentionClass: The decision to delay a booster dose of tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine following an injury should be based on the nature of the injury and likelihood that the injured person is susceptible to tetanus

annotation.spannedText: The more likely the person is to be susceptible, the more quickly that tetanus prophylaxis should be administered

classMention.mentionClass: The more likely the person is to be susceptible, the more quickly that tetanus prophylaxis should be administered

annotation.spannedText: The more likely a person is to be completely susceptible to tetanus (i.e., unvaccinated or incompletely vaccinated), the sooner that TIG and Td/Tdap should be administered, even if it means a trip to the emergency department

classMention.mentionClass: The more likely a person is to be completely susceptible to tetanus (i.e., unvaccinated or incompletely vaccinated), the sooner that TIG and Td/Tdap should be administered, even if it means a trip to the emergency department

annotation.spannedText: TIG should be given as soon as possible after the injury

classMention.mentionClass: TIG should be given as soon as possible after the injury

annotation.spannedText: For a person believed to be completely unvaccinated, it is suggested to increase this interval to 3 weeks (i.e., up to day 21 post injury). Td or Tdap should be given concurrently

classMention.mentionClass: For a person believed to be completely unvaccinated, it is suggested to increase this interval to 3 weeks (i.e., up to day 21 post injury). Td or Tdap should be given concurrently
